messages.subject: Re: burqua and child respect
messages.msgSnippet: Thaks for the list of clothing, Joyce.  I thought we had a lot of different types of clothes here!  I wonder what a goatee is? I haven t been able to figure
messages.messageBody:
Thaks for the list of clothing, Joyce. I thought we had a lot of different
types of clothes here! I wonder what a 'goatee' is?

I haven't been able to figure out when a fetus becomes a child, so I have
backed it up to conception. When would the eagle or the turtle in an egg
become the animal? Even if it is only a "potential"... Because I think the
life is at conception, I think abortion and child respect are incompatible.

I used to be in favor of the death penalty - after all, it's in the Bible!
But now I don't support that either (the penalty, not the Bible). I think
that respect for life means all life (so far human, but I may be moving
toward some veg beliefs), so whether it is young or old or possibly
criminal, I think we should honor and protect the individual.

For unschoolers, this can mean the way we treat infants and the way we treat
the elderly, as well as taking a position on the death penalty (I think it's
great that some gov. is commuting all the sentences in the state to life).
It can also mean calling about the possible (probable) war on the White
House # that was given earlier (202) 456-1111. If we respect life, then it
should be all life - our children, those in the military, and people who
wear clothes that are very different from ours! Pray for peace.

Brenda Rose
